intro: Garnotia, commonly known as the bluebell of the genus, is a flowering plant belonging to the Primulaceae family. It is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Garnotia has elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It plays an important role in supporting pollinators like bees and butterflies during the early part of the growing season.
